page.title: 18GHOST STORIES, DERVOCK.
page.content: There are many folk tales told in our district. Here are versions of two. {THE GREY LADY.}She is said to haunt Montgomery's House at Benvarden. One night as a man walked home past the chapel, a little girl walked out in front of him. Since it was after midnight he asked her if it wasn't a bit late for her to be out. She turned round. Her face was that of an old woman and very wrinkled. She ran into the bushes and disappeared. {THE BLACK MAN.}He was supposed to be buried in Paddy's Field and is said to haunt the nearby rectory. One night a man walking across the field bumped into a dark figure, wearing a black cloak and hat. He started to run. The figure ran after him. The man fell into the Black Man's empty grave and lay there till the morning_too frightened to move.
